thread.title: Federal judge in Detroit orders temporary halt to Trump immigration restrictions - Channel NewsAsia
thread.title_full: Federal judge in Detroit orders temporary halt to Trump immigration restrictions - Channel NewsAsia

title: Federal judge in Detroit orders temporary halt to Trump immigration restrictions - Channel NewsAsia
text:
World Federal judge in Detroit orders temporary halt to Trump immigration restrictions A federal judge in Detroit has issued an order temporarily restraining the Trump administration from carrying out its immigration restrictions. Posted 03 Feb 2017 21:26 File photo of U.S. President Donald Trump. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst A 
DETROIT: A federal judge in Detroit has issued an order temporarily restraining the Trump administration from carrying out its recently announced immigration restrictions. 
US District Judge Victoria Roberts issued the order on Friday (Feb 3) on behalf of the Arab American Civil Rights League, according to ClickOnDetroit.com. 
The judge ordered that the US is "permanently enjoined from applying sections of the executive order against lawful permanent residents of the United States," reported local media. 
President Trump's executive order temporarily put a stop to the US refugee programme, and also temporarily suspended entry for people from seven predominantly Muslim countries - Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen - for 90 days. - Reuters/nc
